creator: mypepper@lwgreys.com
text:
I have version 2.2.3 and have this problem of php module not loading.
Here is the error:
httpd.exe: Syntax error on line 116 of E:/Apache/conf/httpd.conf: Cannot load 
E:/php/php5/php5apache2.dll into server: The specified module could not be 
found.

I have even copied the php module to the apache modules director and still get 
the error:
httpd.exe: Syntax error on line 116 of E:/Apache/conf/httpd.conf: Cannot load 
E:/Apache/modules/php5apache2.dll into server: The specified module could not 
be found.

I also tried php version 4 and get error:
httpd.exe: Syntax error on line 116 of E:/Apache/conf/httpd.conf: Cannot load 
E:/php/php4/php4apache2.dll into server: The specified module could not be 
found.

The same thing happens even if apache and php are installed on drive c.

I have had no problems with version 2.0.55 loading these modules.

The same problem occur on XP-SP2.
Tried for php4.4.1 and php4.4.4.
Tried a couple of workarounds ( PATH, php4apache2.dll
moved on root, on c:\windows\sys...).
PHP still “unloadable”.
creator: valentin.green@gmail.com
rpluem@apache.org
text:
2.0.x and 2.2.x modules are binary incompatible. You must use a php module that
is compiled against 2.2.x. The one you used for 2.0.x does not work with 2.2.x.
